history.content:
Are you interested in Computer Science or Electrical Engineering but not sure what exactly you want to do with it? The possibilities are almost endless - from machine learning to computer security to integrated circuits - and we know that it may be difficult to decide what path you want to pursue, especially if you haven’t had much experience in these fields.

While it may be tempting to blindly choose a class and hope that you enjoy the subject, we have another option for you which might save you from wasting a semester on a course you could care less about.

If you want to explore the diverse world of CS and EE, consider taking HKN’s Going Down the EECS Stack Decal. This 1-unit course provides a broad survey of the many possible applications of computer science and electrical engineering, giving a detailed overview and offering hands-on experience for each subject we cover. By taking this class we hope that you will gain a better sense of what fields you might be interested pursuing in-depth, and help you find classes and resources at Berkeley which will help further these interests.

To apply for the class or for more information, visit https://hkn.mu/decal or email decal@hkn.eecs.berkeley.edu. This DeCal is open to all majors and no prior EE or CS experience is required.
history.subject: Want to explore EECS? Take HKN's Going Down the EECS Stack Decal
